title: Contributing
text: contributing repository, please first discuss change wish make via issue, email, method owners repository making change.

title: Contributing
text: library uses R-code generation process r6-generator-maven-plugin rJava. Google API OAuth client id required. repository include client_secrets.json file must included symbolic link project cloned running mvn install. Installation fail without resulting library work. relevance development. use bundled must get client_secret.json file : https://developers.Google.com/identity/protocols/oauth2 https://console.cloud.Google.com/apis/credentials?project=your_project_name requesting OAuth client id; type “desktop application”. client_secret.json file saved outside github repository, symbolic linked src/main/resources directory. Symbolic links implicitly ignored github, also explicitly excluded .gitignore: e.g. case: R: N.b. make changes java part library sometimes caching issues. Full restart R maybe required, rebuild data. Tweaking library whilst complex analysis generally good idea (experience).
code: cd ~/Git/roogledocs/src/main mkdir resources cd resources ln -s ~/Dropbox/roogledocs/client_secret.json cd ~/Git/roogledocs mvn install devtools::load_all("~/Git/roogledocs",force = TRUE)

title: Contributing
text: OAuth client secrets really necessarily secret? Generic answer Google secrets: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/62315535/---security-concerns--sharing--client-secrets---Google-api difference OAuth client id secret types discussed page states: "Installed applications: Google OAuth 2.0 endpoint supports applications installed devices computers, mobile devices, tablets. create client ID Google API Console, specify Installed application, select Android, Chrome app, iOS, Universal Windows Platform (UWP), Desktop app application type. process results client ID , cases, client secret, embed source code application. (context, client secret obviously treated secret.)" suggests issue situation. either event storing raw client_secrets.json file github seems lika bad idea. However github distribution method library actually possible totally avoid security issues.

title: Using roogledocs
text: Inserting tables document done index. already blank table 1 document. moment support huxtable tables plain data-frames. following chunk creates sample huxtable diamonds data set, applies formatting replaces content table one template data. formatting preserved less. support basic text formatting, borders (black solid present), background colour, alignment. table respect column widths relative measure command takes overall table width parameter. Layout depend content. Custom row heights supported.
code: hux = diamonds %>% mutate(colorCat = ifelse(color <= "G", "D-G","G-J")) %>% group_by(cut,colorCat) %>% summarise(   `Size (mean + sd)` = sprintf("%1.2f \u00B1 %1.2f",mean(carat),sd(carat)),   `Cost (mean + sd)` = sprintf("%1.0f \u00B1 %1.0f",mean(price),sd(price)) ) %>% huxtable::as_hux() %>%   huxtable::theme_article() %>%    huxtable::set_all_padding(value = 0) %>%   huxtable::merge_repeated_rows() ## `summarise()` has grouped output by 'cut'. You can override using the `.groups` ## argument.  hux %>% roogledocs::as.long_format_table() %>% doc$updateTable(tableIndex = 1,tableWidthInches = 4) ## Adding missing grouping variables: `maxRow` ## Table 1 updated  hux

title: Using roogledocs
text: similar process exists figures. need figure PNG image local computer result , example, ggplot. local PNG available, temporarily uploaded Google drive, added document temporary drive file deleted. example update figure 1 replacing {{figure_1}} tag original Google doc image:  Updating second figure can happen way, case use alternative specifying index insertion. dimensions image Google doc exactly match dimensions PNG file saved R. means change size image R changed document. Image dimensions therefore important decide R. figure table already existed target Google doc (e.g. started blank document) simply uploaded added end document sequentially numbered image. rearrange order figures Google doc fix indexes code. Captions handled assumed captions maintained Google doc R (see “Updating tagged text” section later).  Along updating figure within document png useful also able keep copy figure document publication ready format pdf. might also generating supplementary material / data, tables separate word document. work flow generated R scripts. Automatically uploading documents folder Google drive makes managing output analysis fairly straightforward. Google Drive can multiple files name directory behaviour must specified file already exists.
code: g = ggplot(diamonds, aes(x=carat,y=price, colour=color))+geom_point() figure_1 = fs::path(tempdir(),"figure_1_original.png") ggsave(figure_1, g, width=6, height=3)  # If the first parameter is passed as a variable and no tag is given,  # as in this example the variable name is used as the tag and the image is  # inserted into the document at the location of the tag:  doc$updateTaggedImage(figure_1) ## 2022-11-21 13:36:01,320 INFO org.github.terminological.roogledocs.RService [main] Uploading: figure_1_original.png; with type: image/png ## 2022-11-21 13:36:04,511 INFO org.github.terminological.roogledocs.RDocument [main] Autotext replacing: {{figure_1}} with image: https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/IFGspewIEQSujJQFcfi5emCjFFhpfBSAhE05B0KDxBC89_5e4HH8v8ZMnIky3yVAXSpyDyjqPV7FZK8=s16383 ## Figure figure_1 updated ## 2022-11-21 13:36:07,381 INFO org.github.terminological.roogledocs.RService [main] Deleting file: figure_1_original.png  # This is equivalent to: # doc$updateTaggedImage(figure_1, tagName = "figure_1")  g g2 = ggplot(diamonds, aes(x=cut,y=price, fill=cut))+   geom_violin(draw_quantiles = c(0.95,0.5,0.05))+   scale_fill_brewer() filename = tempfile(fileext = ".png") # ggsave default units is inches: ggsave(filename, g2, width=4, height=3)  # The figure index has to be calculated with respect to any changes that have  # already been made in the document. In this case inserting figure 1 before # means this is inserted in the right place, but it is up to the user to make  # sure this is right. filename %>% doc$updateFigure(figureIndex = 2) ## 2022-11-21 13:36:09,914 INFO org.github.terminological.roogledocs.RService [main] Uploading: file741707035a665.png; with type: image/png ## Figure 2 updated ## 2022-11-21 13:36:14,899 INFO org.github.terminological.roogledocs.RService [main] Deleting file: file741707035a665.png g2 doc$uploadSupplementaryFiles(absoluteFilePath = figure_1,overwrite = TRUE) ## 2022-11-21 13:36:16,476 INFO org.github.terminological.roogledocs.RoogleDocs [main] Deleting existing file as `overwrite` is true: figure_1_original.png ## 2022-11-21 13:36:16,669 INFO org.github.terminological.roogledocs.RService [main] Deleting file: figure_1_original.png ## 2022-11-21 13:36:17,400 INFO org.github.terminological.roogledocs.RService [main] Uploading: figure_1_original.png; with type: image/png

Finally can write new document PDF, mostly can see done. write document roogledocs links removed: analysis run new version Google document look like .
code: doc$appendText("\nAdding new content\n","HEADING_3")  content = tibble::tribble(   ~label, ~link, ~fontName, ~fontFace,   "Roogledocs", "https://terminological.github.io/roogledocs/r-library/docs/", "Courier New", "plain",   " is also able to add text at the end of the document with complex formatting. ", NA, NA, "plain",   "Supporting fonts and font face formatting such as ",  NA, NA, "plain",   "bold, ", NA, NA, "bold",   "italic ", NA, NA, "italic",   "and underlined", NA, NA, "underlined",   " amongst other things.", NA, NA, "plain"   )  doc$appendFormattedParagraph(content)  content doc$saveAsPdf(here::here("docs/articles/web-only/example-after-update.pdf")) ## 2022-11-21 13:36:27,347 INFO org.github.terminological.roogledocs.RService [main] Created new document with title: tmp_copy_for_pdf_a9f67c08-7ce1-46ff-bf23-fce46b43571a ## 2022-11-21 13:36:29,412 INFO org.github.terminological.roogledocs.RService [main] Deleting file: tmp_copy_for_pdf_a9f67c08-7ce1-46ff-bf23-fce46b43571a

title: Using roogledocs
text: lot possible ways extend roogledocs. current implementation evolution meet needs. example, additional formatting options text colour implemented relatively straightforward. Currently support lists, fairly simple, didn’t need yet. Absolutely positioned images ignored completely. probably good thing lets logo within document example without messing dynamic images R. Building Google docs based drop officer library MS word good means can leverage interface uses (e.g. knitr support). fairly complex development support Google slides, although simple tagged text image substitution equivalent might simple, reality likely want complex operations.

title: R Wrapper For Googledocs Java Library
text: roogledocs CRAN probably never Java libraries uses bigger CRAN’s stringent policies. Instead R-universe repository. roogledocs depends rJava turn depends working Java installation. recommend installing first. following commands can help determine rJava installation working: rJava working, stable releases roogledocs can installed following: Alternatively unstable development branches can found :
code: install.packages("rJava") rJava::.jinit() rJava::J("java.lang.System")$getProperty("java.version") # Enable repository from terminological options(repos = c(   terminological = 'https://terminological.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Download and install roogledocs in R install.packages('roogledocs') # the --no-multiarch option is required on windows. devtools::install_github("terminological/roogledocs", build_opts = c("--no-multiarch"))

This will impact performance. #> 2022-11-21 13:35:40,288 INFO roogledocs [main] Initialised roogledocs # or a more verbose configuration # J = roogledocs::JavaApi$get("DEBUG")   ## ----------------------------------- ## Method `J$RoogleDocs$new(...)` ## ----------------------------------- if (FALSE) { # no example given - appropriate parameter values must be provided: J$RoogleDocs$new(tokenDirectory, disabled) # or alternatively: roogledocs::new(tokenDirectory, disabled) }  ## ----------------------------------- ## Method `J$RoogleDocs$reauth(...)` ## Aliased as `roogledocs::reauth(...)` ## ----------------------------------- if (FALSE) { # no example given - appropriate parameter values must be provided: J$RoogleDocs$reauth(tokenDirectory) # or alternatively: roogledocs::reauth(tokenDirectory) }  ## ----------------------------------- ## Method `J$RoogleDocs$docById(...)` ## Aliased as `roogledocs::doc_by_id(...)` ## ----------------------------------- if (FALSE) { # no example given - appropriate parameter values must be provided: J$RoogleDocs$docByName(title, tokenDirectory, disabled) # or alternatively: roogledocs::doc_by_name(title, tokenDirectory, disabled) }  ## ----------------------------------- ## Method `J$RoogleDocs$docFromTemplate(...)` ## Aliased as `roogledocs::doc_from_template(...)` ## ----------------------------------- if (FALSE) { # no example given - appropriate parameter values must be provided: J$RoogleDocs$docFromTemplate(title, templateUri, tokenDirectory, disabled) # or alternatively: roogledocs::doc_from_template(title, templateUri, tokenDirectory, disabled) }  ## ----------------------------------- ## Method `J$RoogleDocs$searchForDocuments(...)` ## Aliased as `roogledocs::search_for_documents(...)` ## ----------------------------------- if (FALSE) { # no example given - appropriate parameter values must be provided: J$RoogleDocs$searchForDocuments(titleMatch, tokenDirectory) # or alternatively: roogledocs::search_for_documents(titleMatch, tokenDirectory) }  ## ----------------------------------- ## Method `J$RoogleDocs$deleteDocument(...)` ## Aliased as `roogledocs::delete_document(...)` ## ----------------------------------- if (FALSE) { # no example given - title: RoogleDocs — RoogleDocs
text: R library perform limited interactions google docs (maybe one day slides) R via Java API library. purpose support google docs platform interactive development documentation data analysis R scientific publication, although limited purpose. workflow supported parallel documentation analysis team people working collaboratively documentation, whilst time analysis performed results updated repeatedly result new data. environment updating numeric results, tabular data figures word documents manually becomes annoying. roogledocs can automate bit like RMarkdown document, added benefit content can updated independently analysis, wider team.

Substitutes occurrences tag-name image local storage. limited circumstances using good idea. almost always better use `updateFigure()` insert image index. choose ignore warning, beware combining `updateFigure()` potentially figure indexes may change dynamically. image uploaded google drive temporary file, briefly made publically readable. inserted  google doc, one completed temporary file deleted google drive.

title: RoogleDocs — RoogleDocs
text: longFormatTable dataframe consisting table content formatting indexed row column. minimum columns label,row,col, may also include rowSpan,colSpan,fillColour, leftBorderWeight, rightBorderWeight, topBorderWeight, bottomBorderWeight, alignment (START,CENTER,END), valignment (TOP,MIDDLE,BOTTOM), fontName, fontFace, fontSize. - (java expects RDataframe) tableIndex table index document? can left new table end document. - (defaulting `-1`) - (java expects int) colWidths vector including relative length column. can left longFormatTable comes .long_format_table - (defaulting `attr(longFormatTable,'colWidths')`) - (java expects RNumericVector) tableWidthInches final width table inches (defaults size fits A4 page margins) - (defaulting `6.2`) - (java expects RNumeric)

what: Convert a table to long format — as.long_format_table
title: Convert a table to long format — as.long_format_table
text: Converts square display table format long format suitable applying sequence formatting operations google doc ggplot. Currently plain dataframes huxtables supported flextables look doable. limited subset formatting features implemented present supported roogledocs. output format simple dataframe following columns:

title: Convert a table to long format — as.long_format_table
code: as.long_format_table(table, ...)

title: Convert a table to long format — as.long_format_table
text: table input table (e.g. huxtable) ... passed onto subclass methods

title: Convert a table to long format — as.long_format_table
text: format considered valid roogledocs::RoogleDocs$updateTable()

title: Convert a table to long format — as.long_format_table
text: - Character: label - non blank text (single space OK empty string) - Integer: row - must integer, 1-based top left - Integer: col - must integer, 1-based top left - Integer: rowSpan - must integer, minimum value 1 - Integer: colSpan - must integer, minimum value 1 - Character: fontName - font name seen font drop google docs e.g "Roboto","Arial","Times New Roman", unrecognised values displayed Arial - Character: fontFace - one "bold", "bold.italic", "italic", "plain" - Numeric: fontSize - points - Character: fillColour - hex string e.g. "#aaaaaa". N.b. British English spelling (sorry) - Numeric: leftBorderWeight - border weight points - minimum size appears google docs 0.5 - Numeric: rightBorderWeight - Numeric: topBorderWeight - Numeric: bottomBorderWeight - Character: alignment - one "START","CENTER","END" - Character: valignment - one "TOP","MIDDLE","BOTTOM" also attribute `colWidths` vector length width table containing relative widths columns. overall table width decided rendering. supported moment border line types, border colours, control padding, row height control, alignment decimal point, complex content / markup cells.

what: roogledocs: R Wrapper For Googledocs Java Library — roogledocs-package
title: roogledocs: R Wrapper For Googledocs Java Library — roogledocs-package
text: Programmatically substitute images, data tables google doc. R library perform limited interactions google docs (maybe one day slides) R via Java API library. purpose support google docs platform interactive development documentation data analysis R scientific publication, although limited purpose. workflow supported parallel documentation analysis team people working collaboratively documentation, whilst time analysis performed results updated repeatedly result new data. environment updating numeric results, tabular data figures word documents manually becomes annoying. roogledocs can automate bit like RMarkdown document, added benefit content can updated independently analysis, wider team. Version: 0.2.0 Classes: JavaApi RoogleDocs

title: roogledocs: R Wrapper For Googledocs Java Library — roogledocs-package
